item.title: Line of strewn garbage on Trafalgar Road, 15th September
item.description:
Caught the picture this morning (15 Sep 2025). A literal line of garbage on the side of the pavement opposite Christchurch Forum, on Trafalgar road. In general that side of the road is pretty unclean. There's a lot of restaurants, shops, etc that leave their garbage outside or don't clean the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 158, Trafalgar Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain Drainage is blocked., 15th September
item.description:
Hi Team, For hollingworth road, rain water drainage runs from behind all of the houses from house-1 to house 47 and then rejoins the street. I have 3 rain water manholes on my property. House-47 the rain water drain is blocked. I can see some semi solid objects floating as well. I had called a plumber to check my drains / manhole. The first manhole water goes through quickly, the second manhole water is stagnated and foul smelling. The third manhole water is passing very slowly. It is only a matter of time before the drain completely blocks and will cause flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollingworth Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1X Veolia Green Bag not collected??, 15th September
item.description:
Hi, I noticed last week and again today that there had been a litter pick in the area, but the green veolia bag had not been collected. It is located next to the fly tip FixMyStreet ref: 8144286 where items have since been further destroyed and strewn all over the place (I cannot do an update on the original ticket, so wanted to bring it to your attention which you will be able to see from the picture for the incident raised today for the green bag. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22A,22B,22C,22D, Sholden Gardens, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The litter bin is in the allay at king hall road end what allay and allay run up to clock house station s gets missed, 15th September
item.description:
Urgent Concern: Waste Management Issues on King Hall Road Alleyway I am writing to raise an urgent concern regarding the waste management in the alleyway adjacent to 79 King Hall Road, which leads up to Clock House Station. The refuse bin in this location is frequently overflowing, resulting in widespread litter and attracting vermin such as rats and foxes. This poses serious health and hygiene risks to residents and pedestrians, including the potential spread of bacteria, unpleasant odours, and increased risk of slips or injuries due to scattered waste. It appears that this area is consistently overlooked during routine collections. To mitigate these risks and maintain public hygiene, I strongly recommend that waste collection in this alleyway be scheduled at least four times a week. I urge the relevant team to investigate this matter promptly and implement a sustainable solution to ensure regular maintenance and cleanliness. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
